title: MCA: Chinese nationals duped out of millions here

organizations.name: mca public services and complaints department

text:
More 
Chinese nationals are being cheated in the millions via scams in Malaysian businesses. 
Bernama quoted MCA Public Services and Complaints Department head Michael Chong saying the majority of the victims were duped in the property sector and Multi-Level Marketing (MLM) schemes. 
"They come to us (MCA) to seek our help, especially those who have purchased property here. We are talking about millions of ringgit being invested unknowingly, in these scams. 
"After buying houses here, they claim to be cheated by the developer where in such instances, Bumiputera reserve land were sold to them," he told a press conference at Wisma MCA in Ampang, today. 
Chong said the deals were made in their home country and when they came to Malaysia, they realised there were no proper deals, resulting in losses amounting to millions of ringgit. 
Meanwhile, Chong said the number of Chinese nationals being duped by local MLM businesses as also constantly growing. 
According to him, many of the victims fall for such scams after VIPs names were used. 
"They (the scammers) will offer the victims something with super-returns and many, due to greed, have fallen into the trap. 
"By the time they reach out for help, it is too late.They (the victims) have lodged police reports here, so we let the authorities handle their cases now," Chong said. 
He stressed that there were proper guidelines to purchase property in the country and said those with doubt can always enquire with their lawyers or conduct checks with the Malaysian embassy in their home countries before getting into deals involving money. 
"They can even enquire from us (MCA Public Services and Complaints Department) or our Malaysia-China Welfare Advisory Council which is recognised by the Chinese embassy here," he said.
